User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_2) AppleWebKit/534.51.22 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1.1 Safari/534.51.22

Steps to reproduce:

* Did a clean install of Lion.
* Migrated apps and users from old system
* Attempted to launch Firefox, received the Profile Missing dialog.
* Verified that 
  * the ~/Library/Application Support/Firefox directory was present
  * the ~/Library/Application Support/Firefox/profiles.ini file was sane
  * the permissions were correct. Ran "sudo chown `id -un`:`id -gn` ~/Library/Application Support/Firefox" to be sure.

I used lsof on a working installation of Firefox on a different Lion install to see what files were opened, noticed that some files were located under ~/Library/Caches.

Creating the ~/Library/Caches folder (with correct ownership and permissions) allowed Firefox to launch. Removing ~/Library/Caches shows the same error.


Actual results:

Received the "Profile Missing/Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible" error message.


Expected results:

Firefox should have loaded without issues.
